integration_files.file_path: g:\My Drive\Databases\AI Tools\Quantum modeling & Simulation Database\Open Source Quantum Modeling Packages.docx
integration_files.parent_folder: g:\My Drive\Databases\AI Tools\Quantum modeling & Simulation Database
integration_files.text_snippet:
Integration of Advanced AI Tools with DOE and Bayesian Networks for Chalcogenide Compound Research
Objective
The primary goal of Task 1 Integration is to combine advanced AI tools with Design of Experiments (DOE) and Bayesian Networks for the comprehensive research, validation, and formulation of chalcogenide compounds. This effort specifically targets the selection and analysis of 10 mixed-element compounds from a group of 16 materials within the project’s scope.
1. AI Tool Categories Grouped by Function
a) Advanced Quantum AI and Simulation
A variety of quantum computing platforms are utilized to support quantum chemistry modeling and simulation. These include:
Qiskit (IBM): Used for quantum chemistry modeling and implementing variational algorithms.
Cirq (Google): Employed for designing quantum circuits and conducting noisy simulations.
PennyLane (Xanadu): Applied in hybrid quantum-classical machine learning for materials science.
QuTiP, ProjectQ, Strawberry Fields: Open-source plat

integration_files.file_path: g:\My Drive\Databases\AI Tools\Install-Downloading AI Tools\Quantum_Tools_Next_Steps.xlsx
integration_files.text_snippet:
Provider Tool/SDK Account/Portal Auth Type Install + Configure Smoke Test Notes
IBM Quantum Qiskit https://quantum.ibm.com/ API token In IBM Quantum web UI: Profile → API token. In shell: `qiskit-ibm-provider` then `qiskit-ibm-provider -h`. In Python: `from qiskit_ibm_runtime import QiskitRuntimeService; QiskitRuntimeService.save_account(token='...')` Python: `from qiskit_ibm_runtime import QiskitRuntimeService; print(QiskitRuntimeService().backends())` Use `qiskit-aer` for local sim; Runtime for cloud.
D-Wave Ocean SDK / Leap https://cloud.dwavesys.com/leap/ API token Install: `pip install dwave-ocean-sdk`. Configure: `dwave config create` then paste token. Python: `from dwave.system import DWaveSampler; print(DWaveSampler().properties['num_qubits'])` Access requires active plan or trial.
Rigetti pyQuil / QCS https://www.rigetti.com/qcs API key + QCS setup Install: `pip install pyquil`. Configure: `qcs configure` then follow prompts or set `QCS_SETTINGS_APPLICATIONS_PYQUIL_EXECUTABLE`

integration_files.file_path: g:\My Drive\Databases\AI Tools\Categorizing the Tools & Their Strengths.docx
integration_files.text_snippet:
Tab 1
1. Categorizing the Tools & Their Strengths
Here are categories and representative tools from your list, with their core capabilities:
One tool to highlight: TenCirChem — it’s an open-source Python package (based on TensorCircuit) optimized for molecular properties and quantum circuit simulations. (GitHub)


2. How to Incorporate These Tools into the Pipeline
Below is a mapping of pipeline stages to how these tools can be integrated:
This hybrid approach allows you to scale — you run approximate classical methods for many candidates, and occasionally run quantum / high-fidelity simulation for frontier candidates.

3. Architectural Design: Modular Backend Abstraction
To support multiple simulation backends (classical or quantum), you should design your pipeline with an abstraction layer — e.g.:
Backend Interface
  ├── ClassicalBackend (e.g. DFT, with methods: run(), parse(), validate())
  └── QuantumBackend (e.g. VQE, noisy circuits; methods: run(), parse(), noise_model())
Your

integration_files.text_snippet:
Quantum Chemistry and Materials Modeling Tools for Q-SMEC Optimization
Overview
This section presents a comprehensive analysis of quantum chemistry and materials modeling tools relevant to Q-SMEC optimization. The focus is on the selection and classification of AI tools, modeling environments, and quantum artificial intelligence platforms, specifically tailored for tasks involving advanced modeling, simulation, and design of experiments.
Q-SMEC Materials and Task Requirements
Task 1 of Q-SMEC requires the integration of AI tools, with an emphasis on leveraging both advanced modeling and simulation alongside design of experiments (DOE), including Bayesian networks. The process involves research, validation, and formulation of AI solutions that address these requirements. In addition, there is a need to explore other AI tools beyond the pre-defined toolkit to ensure comprehensive coverage.
A key focus is the analysis and development of compounds containing one or more of sixteen material

integration_files.file_path: g:\My Drive\Databases\AI Tools\(FULL) Q-Smec Pipeline Repository (1).docx
integration_files.text_snippet:
Tab 1
Full qsmec_pipeline repository 
Complete working starter repo for QSMEC DOE pipeline with support for:
Classical: Gaussian, QE, Psi4, ORCA, DIRAC

Quantum: TenCirChem, Qiskit, PennyLane, OpenFermion, OpenAtom

Input templates, parsing, and optimization

Full test suite

CLI interface

Deployment & Usage GuidelinesFor clusters utilizing SLURM
Customize slurm_template.sh.
Pass --slurm to enable SLURM job dispatch (add flag in cli.py).
Utilize JobManager.submit_slurm(...).
For researchers
Load materials from Materials Project or a local .cif file.
Cache results in a CSV or SQLite database.
Incorporate a dashboard front-end via Streamlit.
For advanced development
Implement hybrid workflows (e.g., classical prefiltering, quantum refinement).
Employ the ask() / tell() loop from skopt to monitor optimization in real-time.
Add parallel evaluation using multiprocessing.Pool or joblib.





Core Repository Files
📁 qsmec_pipeline/
README.md

integration_files.file_path: g:\My Drive\Databases\AI Tools\Quantum_Tools_Addons_Master_Report_Updated.docx
integration_files.text_snippet:
Quantum Integrations Master Report
Part 1 — Core Frameworks and SDKs
OpenFermion
Category: Core Library
Usage: Bridge between quantum chemistry and quantum computing
Install Command: pip install openfermion
Primary Prerequisites: Python, NumPy
URL: http://www.openfermion.org/
Open Source: Yes

Psi4
Category: Core Chemistry Engine
Usage: Performs ab initio quantum chemistry calculations
Install Command: conda install -c conda-forge psi4
Primary Prerequisites: Conda, Python
URL: https://psicode.org/
Open Source: Yes

PySCF
Category: Core Library
Usage: Python-based framework for quantum chemistry simulations
Install Command: pip install pyscf
Primary Prerequisites: Python
URL: https://pyscf.org/
Open Source: Yes

ProjectQ
Category: Quantum SDK
Usage: Design, simulate, and run quantum algorithms
Install Command: pip install projectq
Primary Prerequisites: Python
URL: https://projectq.ch/
Open Source: Yes

Qiskit (IBM)
Category: Quantum SDK
Usage: Build and execute quantum algorithms on IB
